Math.RandomGenerator class

　Math.RandomGenerator is a class for generating random numbers using the Mersenne Twister method.

　The syntax of the constructor is as follows.
new Math.RandomGenerator([<random_number_series>]);

　If you specify a number in the constructor, the random number generator will be initialized with that number.
　If you specify a dictionary array object whose state is saved by the serialize method in the constructor (shown below), you can create a random number generator in that state.
　If you omit the constructor, the random number generator is initialized with a random value based on the current time (in case of Kirikiri 2, it is initialized with a random number from the random number generator based on environmental noise, not the current time).

randomize

　The randomize method initializes the random number generator. The arguments are the same as those specified in the constructor.

random

　The random method returns a real random value between 0 and 1.0.

random32

　The random32 method returns an integer random value greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 4,294,967,295 (less than or equal to 0xffffffff).

random63

　The random63 method returns an integer random value between 0 and 9,223,372,036,854,775,807 (0x7ffffffffffffffff and below).

random64

　The random64 method returns a random integer value greater than or equal to -9,223,372,036,854,775,808 and less than or equal to 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.

serialize

　The serialize method returns a dictionary array object that records the current state. This dictionary array object can reproduce the current state again by passing it to the constructor or randomize method.

Copyright notice

　The implementation of the Mersenne Twister method includes

A C-program for MT19937, with initialization improved 2002/2/10. Coded by Takuji Nishimura and Makoto Matsumoto.

　We are using a modified version.Thanks to both of them for publishing useful program sources.
